The fxsvgImage library allows to convert a SVG file to a JavaFX Node tree or an Image.
Note that contrary to other existing libraries, this library has no external dependencies (including Batik).
The most simple way to use the library is just by calling the SVGLoader.load static method:
SVGImage img = SVGLoader.load(<my SVG file>);
The SVGImage class is a JavaFX Group.
This library supports:
px, pt, cm, mm, on, and % units. See also
filters. See also
clip paths. See also
linear and radial gradients. See also
the style element. See also
rect, circle, ellipse, path, polygon, polyline, line, image, text, tspan elements. See also
the symbol element. See also
the use element. See also
fill, stroke, style, class attributes. See also
transform attributes. See also
